hero.title: Gabriel Gauthier
hero.subtitle: Programmer – Game and Software Development
hero.tagline: A detail-oriented programmer with a strong background in game design

about.title: Gabriel Gauthier
about.intro: Hi! I’m a programmer with a bachelor’s degree in game creation from UQAT and a certificate in applied computer science from UdeM. Curious and always eager to learn, I love coding, solving technical challenges, and bringing ideas to life through well-designed systems. I enjoy collaborating with passionate people, sharing knowledge, and helping projects move forward in a positive team environment. I’d love the opportunity to build something great with you!

involved.title: Dedicated
involved.text: When I take on a new project, I fully commit and see it through to the end.

feedback.title: Open to feedback
feedback.text: I’m at the beginning of my career and still have areas to improve. I appreciate constructive feedback that helps me grow.

curiosity.title: Eager to learn
curiosity.text: I love learning new things. If I have an opportunity to improve or develop new skills, I’m always in.

where.title: Where do I see myself?
where.text: My dream job would be in a motivated, organized, and fun team where everyone can share ideas and shine together. One day, I might like to become a technical lead.

what.title: What kind of projects?
what.text: I’ve worked on many projects, but my favorites are innovative games. I love adventure and puzzle games like It Takes Two, and I also enjoyed working on virtual reality projects.

engines.title: Unity - Unreal
engines.text: To bring my projects and games to life

programming.title: Java - C++ - C#
programming.text: To build strong and flexible systems

xr.title: Mixed Reality
xr.text: To push the limits of what’s possible

games.title: Video games
games.text: I love video games for the emotions they create and the endless possibilities they offer. They’ve always pushed me to grow and inspired me to create memorable experiences.

nature.title: Nature
nature.text: Fascinated by wildlife and plants. I enjoy calm moments, exploration, and the peace nature provides.

anime.title: Japanese anime
anime.text: I fell in love with their culture and values, especially perseverance and self-improvement.

boltnpunch.title: Bolt'n'Punch
boltnpunch.description: Bolt’n’Punch is an action game developed with my graduating teammates at UQAT. We followed a full studio production pipeline, from initial concept to official release on Steam.

fioritura.title: Fioritura
fioritura.description: Fioritura was created by a team of 13 passionate students at UQAT. As the project integrator, I was responsible for connecting systems and ensuring technical consistency throughout development.

nineoclock.title: Nine O'Clock
nineoclock.description: Nine O’Clock is a team-based academic project developed by 10 students around an imposed theme. Over the course of a full semester, we designed and delivered a complete playable experience.

rexmontis.title: Rex Montis
rexmontis.description: This game was presented at Chaos Média 2021. It was developed in 8 weeks with the participation of my entire class, simulating a small game studio.

latency.title: Latency
latency.description: We created a fully playable and fun game during our prototyping and experimentation course in 2022, developed over one semester by a team of 6.

carnavalvr.title: Carnaval VR
carnavalvr.description: My first VR game, created during my internship at AleoVR. It was my first experience with VR development and studio production.

livraisonroyale.title: Livraison Royale
livraisonroyale.description: Game created during my first ever Game Jam, developed in 45 hours during the 2022 inter-college game jam competition.

megalophobia.title: Megalophobia
megalophobia.description: Game created during the 2022 Coding Block Game Jam in 3 days with a team of 5, based on the theme 'It’s following me'.
